summary: Experienced science writer with a demonstrated history of working in the IT and Research field. Skilled in developing astronomy community engagement projects, experience in java and python programming, event management, presentation skills and creative content design using adobe photoshop. A designer-entrepreneur at solidArtee aiming to support various causes. Scientifically and technically driven research professional with a Master of Science (MSc) focused in Planetary Science and Astronomy from UCL.

-  Features/Other Editorial:  
          A1 Lighting magazine feature, 2022 and 2023: https://flickread.com/edition/html/643d37aac190d#34
          Daylight and Architecture News 2023: https://www.daylightandarchitecture.com/news/unesco-international-day-of-light/ 
          Women in Lighting interview 2023: https://womeninlighting.com/site/your-interviews/geethu-paulose


The UNESCO International Day of Light (IDL) celebrated annually on 16 May is a global initiative that provides an annual focal point for celebrating the role and importance of light and light-based technologies. Each year, around the International Day of Light, hundreds of events and activities are organised at local, regional, and national levels to celebrate light and the role it plays in science, culture and art, education, and sustainable development.

profile_positions.description:
Cosmochase Community, in association with Universe Awareness @unawe (https://www.unawe.org/about/), as a unique astronomy outreach project, participating in the IAU Global Outreach Events 2020, to connect, motivate and inspire people from different parts of the globe, from all backgrounds and age groups, through their common interest and love for the cosmos with the aid of social media.

The community mainly focuses on:
1. Providing a CREATIVE SPACE to explore and exhibit peoples perspective on the cosmos using their creative skills hence develop a sense of belonging and empathy to one another.  
2. Providing an INTERACTIVE SPACE, to cultivate curiosity and develop scientific interests in people, specially young minds through cosmos themed discussions and activities. 
In doing so, cosmochase aims to build a network of self-motivated, scientifically driven community aiming to meet the goal of IAU in using astronomy as a tool to connect humanity for the betterment of science and society, through collaboration, with respect, tolerance and peace.

profile_positions.description: Analysing sectors of  light curve data from the recently launched Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) to look for planets outside of our own Solar System, that could support life, also understand how these extrasolar systems form and evolve.
profile_positions.title: Planet Hunters TESS Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
- Explores the relationship between metallicities and IMF slope in late type galaxies. The team developed proxy measures to determine bulk gas-phase metallicity and IMF slope for late type galaxies using global observables NIR, FIR , H1 and CO fluxes. 
- My individual objective was to use this proxy to understand if there were any correlation between the number of spiral arms and star formation in galaxies.
- Manually classified face on galaxies from galaxyzoo2 data into 1,2,3,4 and 4+ arm galaxies to extract a strong galaxy sample set. 
- Obtained complete NIR, FIR and H1 flux data for the sample galaxies, directly from the 2MASS survey IRSA archive,  IRAS survey and HIPASS survey /ALFALFA survey and multiple database and indirectly by applying mathematical computations and custom database queries.
- Our initial results showed an interesting correlation between many-arm spiral galaxies and its star formation rate. This opens the scope for further testing and validation.
profile_positions.title: Project Intern, Spiral Galaxies

profile_positions.description: Conducted effective communication and marketing of the international football training program with FC Midtjylland and a regional football tournament MFAR BOCA LEAGUE 2016, Bangalore. Conducted team presentation and interacted with various organisers, football clubs, schools, parents and beneficiaries as part of hosting the event via emails, telephone and in person. Showcased creative skills and IT expertise when it came to designing posters, brochures and flexes for the event as well as maintaining match statistics, table standings, reminders and team presentations to the participants regarding each event. I also worked in publishing content in social media, regional newspapers as well as edited videos of events to be uploaded on YouTube. I administered the training centres and made sure that the tasks were carried out effectively.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator
